unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever been scrolling through your Instagram feed and BAM! A limited-time offer pops up that makes your heart race? That’s probably a flash sale in action!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever been scrolling through your Instagram feed and BAM! A limited-time offer pops up that makes your heart race? That’s probably a flash sale in action!

unnormalised: We're seeing flash sales everywhere these days, from big e-commerce giants like Flipkart to smaller, family-run businesses in Chandni Chowk. It’s a fantastic tactic in the retail and e-commerce world, and if you're not paying attention, you're potentially missing out on some serious savings.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: you're suddenly craving some delicious Hyderabadi biryani. But instead of waiting for your usual Swiggy delivery, your favorite restaurant, Paradise, announces a "Biryani Bonanza" – 50% off for the next 2 hours! Suddenly, that biryani craving becomes URGENT, right? That's the power of a flash sale.

unnormalised: What makes them so effective? A few things: Scarcity (limited quantities, often described as "while stocks last!"), Urgency (a short time window, think "24-hour sale!"), and of course, HUGE discounts. We’re talking sarees at Rs. 99, smart TVs at 60% off, or even that coveted plot of land near Lonavala at a special rate. It creates a buzz and encourages impulsive purchases.

unnormalised: For businesses, flash sales are a great way to clear out old inventory, boost sales during a slow period, or attract new customers. Imagine a boutique on Linking Road offering a crazy discount on their ethnic wear collection to make space for their new Diwali line.

unnormalised: However, Dr. Sharma, a renowned marketing professor at IIM Bangalore, always emphasizes the importance of responsible flash sale strategies. Too many flash sales can devalue your brand and train customers to only buy when items are heavily discounted.
